results.content: Excellent for the beginners to learn more about the D3js.
results.content_html: Excellent for the beginners to learn more about the D3js.

results.content: The worst Udemy course I have taken so far. No support from instructor at all. According to his "learning philosophy", one learns best by typing everything. Well, I surely know we learn by doing. All I asked for was just a reference to quickly compare my code with. Lesson learned: never take a course from Packt again.
results.content_html: The worst Udemy course I have taken so far. No support from instructor at all. According to his "learning philosophy", one learns best by typing everything. Well, I surely know we learn by doing. All I asked for was just a reference to quickly compare my code with. Lesson learned: never take a course from Packt again.

results.content: very nice comparing raw javascript & D3 way to do the same thing.

results.content: Interesting material, I'd recommend it if you're looking to wrap your mind around D3. With that said, this course is hard to follow since a great part of the supporting material is missing/not given.
results.content_html: Interesting material, I'd recommend it if you're looking to wrap your mind around D3. With that said, this course is hard to follow since a great part of the supporting material is missing/not given.

results.content: The course would be difficult for those who dont have some basic HTML and JavaScript background. And it took a while to get adjusted to the pace of the instructor.
results.content_html: The course would be difficult for those who dont have some basic HTML and JavaScript background. And it took a while to get adjusted to the pace of the instructor.

results.content: The only materials for the course are the first basic example, if you want to be hands on for the rest you have to try and follow the video and get ready to pause because he copy/pastes code from having pre-written it and he jumps around a lot.  Also there's not much info beyond the specific examples he's working on, if you want to apply this knowledge to a project that isn't a copy of what he's doing you're in for a rough ride.
results.content_html: The only materials for the course are the first basic example, if you want to be hands on for the rest you have to try and follow the video and get ready to pause because he copy/pastes code from having pre-written it and he jumps around a lot. Also there's not much info beyond the specific examples he's working on, if you want to apply this knowledge to a project that isn't a copy of what he's doing you're in for a rough ride.

results.content: Great basic intro so far.. very clear and straight forword... very relevant to a beginner wanting to understand from the ground up.
results.content_html: Great basic intro so far.. very clear and straight forword... very relevant to a beginner wanting to understand from the ground up.

results.content:
This is not my favorite thing to do, give a low rating. I will say that the instructor knows the details & has a great grip on coding D3. However this covers D3 v3.x so some of the functions he uses are out-of-date. I asked a question: 

Hi I'm unable to decipher how you arranged the flowers in rows...mine is in columns.
Frank · Lecture 6 · 3 days ago
section 2 Binding data to HTML Elements, #6 

For which the response was:
Hi Frank, 
Thank you for your query. We would appreciate if you elaborate your query to help you better.
Best Regards
Packt 

Listen guys, if I had a better grip on D3 I wouldn't be taking this course! I gave them the section # and lecture # and my problem. 

I'll let you all decide from here...

results.content: There's alot of basic code that is not provided, at times huge amounts of code just appear on the screen and its quite tedious to try to copy it all over.  This would be better if frameworks were produced for these coding examples with only minor steps being required to be added in.
